criteria: Ability to count to 100 by ones.
Ability to count to 100 by tens.
descriptions: Student is unable to count beyond 10.
Student can count to 20 but makes frequent errors or requires significant prompting.
Student can count to 50 with some errors and/or occasional prompting.
Student can count to 70 with minimal errors and only rare prompting.
Student can accurately count to 100 by ones, with only minor hesitations.
Student confidently and accurately counts to 100 by ones without hesitation.
Student is unable to count by tens or struggles to count beyond 30.
Student can count by tens to 40, but makes several errors or requires assistance.
Student can count by tens to 60 with some errors and/or occasional prompting.
Student can count by tens to 80 with minimal errors and only rare prompting.
Student can accurately count to 100 by tens with only minor hesitations.
Student confidently and accurately counts to 100 by tens without hesitation.
Student demonstrates no understanding of the sequence of numbers, even with support.
Student shows a limited understanding of the number sequence; can identify the next number in a sequence with assistance.
Student can identify the next number in a sequence of ones to 20 and tens to 50 with some accuracy.
Student can identify the next number in a sequence of ones to 50 and tens to 80 with reasonable accuracy.
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of the number sequence and can accurately predict subsequent numbers in sequences of ones and tens.
Student demonstrates a thorough understanding of the number sequence and can easily identify patterns and predict numbers in sequences of ones and tens.
